meanings.definition: To focus too narrowly on a particular area of expertise.
meanings.sent1: Some students overspecialize in one subject and miss out on learning about other interesting topics.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to overspecialize in your career, as having a broad skill set can be beneficial.
meanings.sent3: The chef overspecialized in making soufflés and struggled when asked to prepare a simple salad.
meanings.sent4: Don't overspecialize in just one type of exercise; try to incorporate a variety of workouts for better overall fitness.
meanings.sent5: She realized she had overspecialized in painting landscapes and decided to explore abstract art instead.

meanings.definition: To become too specialized in a particular field.
meanings.sent1: Some companies overspecialize in producing one type of product and may struggle to adapt to market changes.
meanings.sent2: It is easy to overspecialize in a niche market and miss out on opportunities in other areas.
meanings.sent3: The scientist overspecialized in studying a rare species of frog and missed important developments in other areas of biology.
meanings.sent4: Just like in nature, it is risky for businesses to overspecialize in a single product without diversifying.
meanings.sent5: He warned his students not to overspecialize too early in their careers, as it could limit their future opportunities.
